rel.description: The relation of the link to the object that belongs to.

AtomLink.description: The links associated to this resource, with `method`, `href` and `rel`.

variables.description: The id of the process instance.

id.description: The id of the process instance.

definitionId.description: The id of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

businessKey.description: The business key of the process instance.

caseInstanceId.description: The id of the case instance associated with the process instance.

ended.description: A flag indicating whether the process instance has ended or not. Deprecated: will always be false!

suspended.description: A flag indicating whether the process instance is suspended or not.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the process instance.

links.description: The links associated to this resource, with `method`, `href` and `rel`.

value.description: Can be any value - string, number, boolean, array or object.  **Note**: Not every endpoint supports every type.

type.description: The value type of the variable.

additionalProperties.description: A JSON object containing additional, value-type-dependent properties. For serialized variables of type Object, the following properties can be provided:  * `objectTypeName`: A string representation of the object's type name. * `serializationDataFormat`: The serialization format used to store the variable.  For serialized variables of type File, the following properties can be provided:  * `filename`: The name of the file. This is not the variable name but the name that will be used when downloading the file again. * `mimetype`: The MIME type of the file that is being uploaded. * `encoding`: The encoding of the file that is being uploaded.  The following property can be provided for all value types:  * `transient`: Indicates whether the variable should be transient or not. See [documentation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.20/user-guide/process-engine/variables#transient-variables) for more informations. (Not applicable for `decision-definition`, ` /process-instance/variables-async`, and `/migration/executeAsync` endpoints)

valueInfo.description: A JSON object containing additional, value-type-dependent properties. For serialized variables of type Object, the following properties can be provided:  * `objectTypeName`: A string representation of the object's type name. * `serializationDataFormat`: The serialization format used to store the variable.  For serialized variables of type File, the following properties can be provided:  * `filename`: The name of the file. This is not the variable name but the name that will be used when downloading the file again. * `mimetype`: The MIME type of the file that is being uploaded. * `encoding`: The encoding of the file that is being uploaded.  The following property can be provided for all value types:  * `transient`: Indicates whether the variable should be transient or not. See [documentation](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.20/user-guide/process-engine/variables#transient-variables) for more informations. (Not applicable for `decision-definition`, ` /process-instance/variables-async`, and `/migration/executeAsync` endpoints)

VariableValueDto.description: The id of the process instance.

id.description: The id of the process instance.

rootProcessInstanceId.description: The process instance id of the root process instance that initiated the process.

superProcessInstanceId.description: The id of the parent process instance, if it exists.

superCaseInstanceId.description: The id of the parent case instance, if it exists.

caseInstanceId.description: The id of the parent case instance, if it exists.

processDefinitionName.description: The name of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

processDefinitionVersion.description: The version of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

processDefinitionId.description: The id of the process definition that this process instance belongs to.

businessKey.description: The business key of the process instance.

startTime.description: The time the instance was started. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.20/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

endTime.description: The time the instance ended. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.20/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

removalTime.description: The time after which the instance should be removed by the History Cleanup job. Default [format](https://docs.camunda.org/manual/7.20/reference/rest/overview/date-format/) `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

durationInMillis.description: The time the instance took to finish (in milliseconds).

startUserId.description: The id of the user who started the process instance.

startActivityId.description: The id of the initial activity that was executed (e.g., a start event).

deleteReason.description: The provided delete reason in case the process instance was canceled during execution.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the process instance.

state.description: Last state of the process instance, possible values are:  `ACTIVE` - running process instance  `SUSPENDED` - suspended process instances  `COMPLETED` - completed through normal end event  `EXTERNALLY_TERMINATED` - terminated externally, for instance through REST API  `INTERNALLY_TERMINATED` - terminated internally, for instance by terminating boundary event
